titles.ar: بَابُ الْجَبْرِ وَ الْقَدَرِ وَ الْأَمْرِ بَيْنَ الْأَمْرَيْنِ
titles.en: Chapter 30 – The Compulsion, and the Pre-determination, and the matter is between the two matters
Chapter 28 – The Happiness and the Misery
The Book of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>)
Chapter 29 – The Good and the Evil

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ وَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ مِمَّا أَوْحَى اللَّهُ إِلَى مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَنْزَلَ عَلَيْهِ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ أَنِّي أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنَا خَلَقْتُ الْخَلْقَ وَ خَلَقْتُ الْخَيْرَ وَ أَجْرَيْتُهُ عَلَى يَدَيْ مَنْ أُحِبُّ فَطُوبَى لِمَنْ أَجْرَيْتُهُ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ
وَ أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنَا خَلَقْتُ الْخَلْقَ وَ خَلَقْتُ الشَّرَّ وَ أَجْرَيْتُهُ عَلَى يَدَيْ مَنْ أُرِيدُهُ فَوَيْلٌ لِمَنْ أَجْرَيْتُهُ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ibn Mahboub and Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Muawiya Bin Wahab who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘From what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Revealed unto Musa<sup>as</sup> and Revealed unto him<sup>as</sup> in the Torah was: “I<sup>azwj</sup>, I<sup>azwj</sup> am Allah<sup>azwj</sup>. There is no god except from Me<sup>azwj</sup>. I<sup>azwj</sup> Created the creatures and Created the Good and Flowed it upon the hands of the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> Love. So Beatitude is for the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> Caused it to flow upon his hands.

And I<sup>azwj</sup> am Allah<sup>azwj</sup>. There is no god except for Me<sup>azwj</sup>. I<sup>azwj</sup> Created the creatures, and Created the evil, and I<sup>azwj</sup> Flowed it upon the hands of the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> Intended to. So, Woe is for the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> Flowed it upon his hands!”’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ فِي بَعْضِ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ كُتُبِهِ أَنِّي أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنَا خَلَقْتُ الْخَيْرَ وَ خَلَقْتُ الشَّرَّ فَطُوبَى لِمَنْ أَجْرَيْتُ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ الْخَيْرَ وَ وَيْلٌ لِمَنْ أَجْرَيْتُ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ الشَّرَّ وَ وَيْلٌ لِمَنْ يَقُولُ كَيْفَ ذَا وَ كَيْفَ ذَا .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muhammad Bin Hakeym, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘I heard Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Among some of what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Revealed from His<sup>azwj</sup> Books was: “I<sup>azwj</sup>, I<sup>azwj</sup> am Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! There is no god except Me<sup>azwj</sup>. I<sup>azwj</sup> Created the good and Created the evil. So beatitude is for the one I<sup>azwj</sup> Cause the good to flow upon his hands and woe be unto the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> Cause the evil to flow upon his hands, and woe is for the one who is saying, ‘How is this so’, and ‘How is that so’”!’

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَكَّارِ بْنِ كَرْدَمٍ عَنْ مُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ وَ عَبْدِ الْمُؤْمِنِ الْأَنْصَارِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنَا خَالِقُ الْخَيْرِ وَ الشَّرِّ فَطُوبَى لِمَنْ أَجْرَيْتُ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ الْخَيْرَ وَ وَيْلٌ لِمَنْ أَجْرَيْتُ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ الشَّرَّ وَ وَيْلٌ لِمَنْ يَقُولُ كَيْفَ ذَا وَ كَيْفَ هَذَا
قَالَ يُونُسُ يَعْنِي مَنْ يُنْكِرُ هَذَا الْأَمْرَ بِتَفَقُّهٍ فِيهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, from Bakkar Bin Kardim, from Mufazzal Bin Umar and Abdul Momin Al Ansary,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Said: “I<sup>azwj</sup> am Allah<sup>azwj</sup>. There is no god except Me<sup>azwj</sup>. I<sup>azwj</sup> am the Creator of the good and the evil. So beatitude is for the one I<sup>azwj</sup> Flow the good upon his hands, and woe is for the one I<sup>azwj</sup> Flow the evil upon his hands, and woe is for the one who is saying, ‘How is that so and how is this so?’.
Yunus (the fourth narrator) said, ‘It means the one who denies this matter by understanding in it’.
